availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Issac Hacker (Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and horse dealer)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, farmer and horse dealer. Kentucky native. Married to Esther Morris Hacker. Father of America M. Hacker, Margaret Elizabeth Hacker, and J. S. Hacker. Farmer in Owsley County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Owsley County in 1860. Horse dealer in Owsley County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 279A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, p. 319.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #994052, Owsley County Deaths, p. 156.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Owsley County Births, p. 2.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 19, Owsley County, Kentucky, 1865, (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Owsley County Deaths.
